Abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive analysis of the DARPA Subterranean Challenge, highlighting advancements in field robotics for subterranean environments. Key insights include the development of resilient robotic systems capable of autonomous navigation, communication, and mapping in complex, unpredictable underground settings. The challenge fostered innovation in sensor technology, machine learning, and multi-robot coordination, demonstrating significant progress toward robust and adaptable robotic solutions for subterranean exploration and disaster response.
